channel.title: Computer Language Shootout
channel.description: Compare programming language performance on a few dozen flawed benchmarks and contribute faster more-elegant programs.

item.title: 21st Feb, Gentoo computer language benchmarks measured
item.description: Lua, Pascal Free Pascal, Scheme Petit Larceny :: ackermann (deprecate), binary-trees, chameneos (new), cheap-concurrency, fannkuch, fasta, harmonic (deprecate), k-nucleotide, mandelbrot, n-body, nsieve, nsieve-bits, partial-sums (new), pidigits, random, recursive (new), regex-dna (new), reverse-complement, spectral-norm, startup, sum-file, takfp (deprecate), tcp-request-reply (deprecate)

item.title: new benchmark to replace harmonic
item.description: The harmonic benchmark is deprecated - it is replaced by 'partial-sums' which provides a naive summation of the harmonic series, and 8 other series.

item.title: 24th Jan, Gentoo computer language benchmarks measured
item.description: C gcc, C# Mono, C++ g++, Haskell GHC, Nice, Oberon-2 OO2C, Python Psyco :: ackermann, harmonic, mandelbrot, n-body, startup, sum-file

item.title: new benchmark to replace ackermann,fibonacci,tak
item.description: The ackermann, fibonacci and tak benchmarks are deprecated - they are replaced by 'recursive' which tests the same naive recursive algorithms.
